intro: Schizolaena charlotteae, commonly known as Charlotte's schizolaena, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in cool, moist environments. Its foliage is usually lance-shaped with a slightly hairy texture, and it produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in the spring. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
